reports.title: NEPAD 2022 - Financing for development in the era of the COVID-19 pandemic: primacy of domestic resource mobilization
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of financing for development in Africa during the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing on the primacy of domestic resource mobilization. The report examines Africa's economic recovery, financing sources, tax mobilization efforts, and the role of digital economy and infrastructure governance in post-pandemic development.

reports.title: NEPAD - 2024: Unpacking the Debt of Africa: Towards a Lasting and Durable Solution
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of Africa's debt challenges and pathways to sustainable solutions. The report examines debt trends from 1970-2022, analyzes the impact of debt servicing on development spending, explores resource-backed loans and transparency issues, and provides recommendations for lasting debt solutions including MDB recapitalization and SDR allocation.

reports.title: NEPAD - 2023: Solving the Paradoxes of Development in Africa: Financing, Energy and Food Systems
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of Africa's interconnected development paradoxes in financing, energy, and food systems. The report examines the continent's vast potential in renewable energy and agricultural resources against persistent challenges in access, efficiency, and investment. It provides data-driven insights on illicit financial flows, energy access gaps, food insecurity, and governance systems while proposing integrated solutions for sustainable development.

reports.title: CoC 2025: Promotion of Durable Peace through Sustainable Development in Africa
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of the intersection between governance, conflict prevention, and sustainable development in Africa. The report examines the social contract renewal, governance backsliding, poverty-conflict linkages, and the role of institutions in promoting durable peace. It provides evidence-based insights on youth employment, extremism drivers, and the economic returns of conflict prevention.

reports.title: CoC 2022 - Governance, Conflict, and Sustainable Development in Africa
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of the complex relationship between governance, conflict, and sustainable development in Africa. The report examines conflict patterns from 2010-2022, governance trends, SDG progress, and the role of traditional institutions. It provides evidence-based insights on governance-conflict correlations, regional variations, and the importance of inclusive governance for sustainable development.

reports.title: CoC 2023: Promotion of Durable Peace and Sustainable Development in Africa
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of the intersection between peace, conflict, and sustainable development in Africa, with particular focus on COVID-19 impacts and recovery. The report examines poverty trends, conflict patterns, terrorism impacts, displacement, and the role of development in building resilience. It provides evidence-based insights on the economic costs of conflict, food insecurity, health impacts, and cross-pillar UN initiatives for sustainable peace.

reports.title: CoC 2024 - Promotion of Durable Peace through Sustainable Development in Africa
reports.summary: Comprehensive analysis of the intersection between migration, climate fragility, governance, and access to justice in Africa. The report examines displacement trends, climate-related conflicts, governance deterioration, and the critical role of inclusive justice systems in building sustainable peace. It provides evidence-based insights on migration drivers, climate vulnerability, gender justice gaps, and the economic costs of conflict and inequality.
